p: It is common wisdom that the Western diet, if often too rich in fat, mainly as saturated, monounsaturated, and polyunsaturated fatty acids of the omega 6 series (such as LA), present in high concentrations in most seed oils [ 63]. It has been suggested that this theoretical unbalance leads to a “dilution” of omega 3 fatty acids, usually scant in most common foods [ 64]. However, this notion is being disproven by accumulated evidence. At least in Europe, consumption of omega 6 PUFAs is actually below the levels recommended by several scientific bodies, such as the American Heart Association (see below).
